note:
Geographer, GIS educator, (map) creator, coffee drinker.

I currently teach full-time as a Lecturer of Geospatial Sciences and Geography at Metropolitan State University of Denver. I teach a variety of classes in GIS and Geography. I live in Chichester, New Hampshire.

I'm interested in SoTL, particularly as it applies to GIS and online learning, developing earth data science skills in students, and aspects of spatial data in social media and online spaces.

note: Professor studying & teaching glaciers, geomorphology, & envi. sci. Newly living & biking in the Northwest. Being depressed about climate change.

I make maps, code, charts, communities, strings of words, compost, & things out of wood. I try not to make CO₂. He/him. Human husband, cat parent.

Current mission: Trying to undo basically every tech marketing trend from the past 20 years. There is a better way.

Software should be open, free, and interchangeable. Devices should obey their owners, not their manufacturers. Data should be controlled by the people it is about. Capitalism should be undone.
I can drive a stick, shoot irons, and write cursive, but not a boomer. Other places you can find me: https://linktr.ee/s.para

note:
YAMG (yet another map geek)
#Cartonaut

You and I are animals that evolved in a universe with at least 3 dimensions plus time. We've been orienting and reorienting ever since we were single cell organisms in the ocean and in the womb. With our senses we've been mapping as long as we can remember (literally, memory is key to our ability to map) and it comes to us like breathing. I'm here to celebrate big deep gulps of fresh maps.

#map #maps #cartography #GIS #mapping #topographic

Doctor of evolutionary biology. Work in science policy. Enjoy following current events, politics, Pokemon, technology, Minecraft, DnD, etc.

Posts on here are strictly my own and do not necessarily represent the views of my employer nor the views of any organization I may be associated with. Reposts do not necessarily indicate endorsement.
